    • Method Detail

      • copyStream

        public static long copyStream(java.io.InputStream is,
                              java.io.OutputStream os)
                       throws java.io.IOException

        Copy one byte stream to another

        Parameters:
        is - input stream to copy from
        os - output stream to copy to
        Returns:
        length transferred (in bytes)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O exception was thrown
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when any problems with parameters

      • copyStream

        public static int copyStream(java.io.Reader is,
                             java.io.Writer os)
                      throws java.io.IOException

        Copy one character stream to another

        Parameters:
        is - input stream to copy from
        os - output stream to copy to
        Returns:
        length transferred (in chars)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O exception was thrown
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when any problems with parameters

      • mkMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> mkMap(java.lang.Object... parameters)

        Build the Map<String,Object> map from the variable arguments list. Argument list need be a set of key/value pairs. Type of the 'key' parameter is always String, type of the 'value' parameter can be any (including null as value)

        Parameters:
        parameters - key/value pairs to parse.
        Returns:
        map built. Can be empty but not null.

      • mkSet

        public static <T> java.util.Set<T> mkSet(java.lang.Class<T> content,
                                         T... parameters)

        Build a set of the given type from the parameter's list

        Type Parameters:
        T - any class to make set instances from
        Parameters:
        content - class of the set content
        parameters - parameters to add to set
        Returns:
        set created with the given parameters

      • loadClasses

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> loadClasses(java.lang.Package... packages)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException

        Get class list from given packages and it's sub-packages. This method can be useful to process all classes from the given packages

        Parameters:
        packages - package list to load classes from
        Returns:
        loaded class list. Can be empty but not null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some exception was thrown
